Posts.Content: hrrypttrfn wrote: Hello everyone.  My name is Brianne and I am only 21 years old.  A few days ago I felt something under my arm, and it has not changed in size or anyhting over that time.  I am making an appointment to see my doctor tomorrow for my work physical, and will bring it up there.  I know that for someone my age, the chances of cancer are almost non-existant, but the chance is still there, even though it is probably something much less worrying.  My mother passed away from Leukemia complications a few years ago, and ever since, any little thing makes me go crazy, and worry myself into a frenzy.  The lump is very small, maybe a centemeter, and I think it is hard, but can be moved, though feels like it might be attatched.  Anyone have any words of comfort ar anything for me before I see my doctor? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lump under right arm, terrified of possibilites hrrypttrfn Kaara

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2011 09:14PM hrrypttrfn wrote: Thanks to everyone for the great words and helpful advice.  I saw the doctor and found out this was an infection from shaving.  It only looked like something more serious.  On an antibiotic, and that should clear it up.  beepbeep, I'm sorry to hear about the crap you're going through as well, you are definitely in my thoughts, and I wish you all the best of luck on thursday.
Posts.Title: Lump under right arm, terrified of possibilites hrrypttrfn Kaara

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2011 09:34PM hrrypttrfn wrote: Thanks for the advice and support, I have an appointment for Wednesday afternoon with GP, so only a day and a half more of waiting :)
Posts.Title: Lump under right arm, terrified of possibilites hrrypttrfn Kaara

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2011 08:29PM hrrypttrfn wrote: Wishing you the best of luck for the test, you are definitely in my thoughts.  I am in a place similar to yours, 21-years-old, found a lump under my arm, and am making an appointment to get it cheched.  Try keeping positive, I'm sure you will be just fine.
